properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 13 at 10:09PM PST until January 14 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Eureka CA
properties.description:
...LIGHT SNOW EXPECTED MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... ...
SIGNIFICANT WINTER STORM LIKELY LATE WEDNESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY...

.Snow levels will drop to near 2500 feet overnight tonight. As a
result, several local highway summits will see additional light
snow accumulations from late this evening through Tuesday morning.

A more significant winter storm is expected to impact the region
late Wednesday afternoon through Thursday, with widespread heavy
mountain snow accumulations likely. Snow levels are expected to
fall from 3000 to nearly 2000 feet Wednesday night, which will
bring heavy snow accumulations to numerous interior mountain
highways, including Highways 299, 36, 3, and potentially 199, in
addition to numerous rural roadways. In addition, accumulating
small hail will be possible in coastal low elevations late
Wednesday night and Thursday. Travel will likely become dangerous
or even temporarily impossible in some high elevation areas, so
please prepare now.

* WHAT...Tonight and Tuesday, additional snow accumulations of 2
to 4 inches above 2500 feet. Late Wednesday through Thursday,
heavy snow likely above 2500 feet. 4 to 8 inches between 2500
and 3500 feet, with totals greater than one foot possible above
3500 feet. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph.

* WHERE...Southern Humboldt Interior County.

* WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 10 AM Tuesday.
For the Winter Storm Watch, from Wednesday afternoon through
Thursday afternoon.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The
hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening
commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest
forecasts for updates on this situation.

The latest road conditions for the state of California can be
obtained by calling 1-800-GAS-ROAD.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM TUESDAY ABOVE 2500 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON ABOVE 2500 FEET
